channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Paediatricians step up to look after children with Covid-19 who are on home recovery
item.description:
October 17, 2021 8:00 PM

The initiative aims to ease the load off hospitals and designated telemedicine providers for home recovery.

item.title: AI bot helps doctors to prioritise attention to urgent Covid-19 cases on home recovery
item.description:
October 17, 2021 8:00 PM

SINGAPORE - An artificial intelligence bot which helps doctors and telemedicine providers to prioritise attention to urgent Covid-19 cases on home recovery could help them better manage their workload, amid the surge in local cases.

item.title: Making military camps more ready for pandemics on the agenda: DSTA CEO
item.description:
October 17, 2021 6:37 PM

Another area being studied is greater use of simulators, augmented reality tools to support SAF training.

item.title: More Primary 6 pupils applied for Direct School Admission this year
item.description:
October 17, 2021 6:00 PM

More pupils are also applying for mainstream secondary schools and the O-level track in IP schools, said MOE.

item.title: To reap benefits of latest digital tech, DSTA must adopt 'fast is good' mindset: CEO
item.description:
October 17, 2021 5:56 PM

Agency needs to change the way it works too avoid 'preparing for the last war', he added.

item.title: Halfway house residents do bit for community with project to spruce up homes
item.description:
October 17, 2021 5:20 PM

The Project Home Pride initiative to renovate and refurbish homes is a collaboration with Sembawang GRC.

item.title: Singaporean marriage solemniser Joanna Portilla: It's in my blood. I love to help others
item.description:
October 17, 2021 5:17 PM

Portilla, 50, solemnising marriages for 15 years and solemnises between 100 and 150 marriages a year.

item.title: He solemnises 500 to 600 Singapore marriages a year, and it's not even a paid job
item.description:
October 17, 2021 5:16 PM

His personal record - solemnising 10 marriages in a single day.

item.title: Recalled Abbott Labs Covid-19 test kits were supplied in S'pore for clinical lab use: HSA
item.description:
October 17, 2021 4:22 PM

HSA said that it is working with Abbott to roll out "appropriate corrective actions" to address issue.

item.title: How to prepare kids for their first social media account
item.description:
October 17, 2021 3:00 PM

Some parenting experts say it is up to the parents to assess when their kids are mature enough for their first social media account.

item.title: Fun With Kids: Halloween fun with the Minions, book to help parents with only child
Direct School Admission: What your child should consider before accepting an offer
item.description:
October 17, 2021 3:00 PM

The DSA route gives Primary 6 pupils the chance to apply to a secondary school using academic and non-academic achievements and talents beyond the PSLE.

item.title: Minor Issues: Too tired to be there for your kids? Consider 'retire now, work later'
Living with birds and bees: 16 HDB projects lauded for good design, construction
item.description:
October 17, 2021 1:57 PM

An award ceremony to recognise all 16 projects will be held at HDB Hub in Toa Payoh on Oct 20.

item.title: Punggol LRT system resumes after signalling fault disrupts train services
item.description:
October 17, 2021 1:48 PM

Rail operator SBS Transit implemented free regular and bridging buses at designated bus stops during disruption.

item.title: New pill offers hope to patients with aggressive form of breast cancer
item.description:
October 17, 2021 9:00 AM

A three-year-long clinical trial to test this new method of treatment started last October.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Oct 17
item.description:
October 17, 2021 8:31 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Sunday, Oct 17.

item.title: Experts see less need to test migrant workers in S'pore who do not have Covid-19 symptoms
item.description:
October 17, 2021 5:00 AM

Workers are being tested regularly so many asymptomatic infections are detected.

item.title: Dorm residents relieved at changes to Covid-19 health protocols
item.description:
October 17, 2021 5:00 AM

SINGAPORE - When Bangladeshi construction worker Titu Md Majadur Rahman used a self-administered antigen rapid test (ART) and tested positive for Covid-19 last Wednesday, he was sent to a recovery facility in the S11 dormitory in Punggol where he stays.

item.title: Cats invade Senoko Power Station after neighbouring facilities close
item.description:
October 17, 2021 5:00 AM

The influx of unsterilised cats at the protected site has raised concerns that it may lead to an increase in the feline population.

item.title: His love for trains drove him to open a special cafe in Singapore
item.description:
October 17, 2021 5:00 AM

Asperger's Syndrome, ADHD and dyslexia did not stop Isaac D'Souza from realising his dream of opening a rail-themed cafe.

item.title: A purr-fect solution to cat boom on Pulau Bukom
item.description:
October 17, 2021 5:00 AM

A population boom since 2019 has catapulted the number of cats up to about 400 on Pulau Bukom.

item.title: S'pore property agents go big on YouTube, TikTok to get eyeballs as Covid-19 curtailed viewings
item.description:
October 17, 2021 5:00 AM

Conventional selling strategies such as door knocking and roadshows are less common these days.

item.title: Recovered Covid-19 patients in S’pore tell their stories
item.description:
October 17, 2021 5:00 AM

The Delta strain currently accounts for nearly all cases in Singapore. Three former patients tell ST health correspondent Linette Lai about their experiences of being diagnosed with the virus.

item.title: What it takes to enjoy prime of life at 50 and beyond
item.description:
October 17, 2021 4:00 AM

New research shows changing attitudes towards ageing among Singaporeans and growing awareness of early financial planning.
